title: 113_hr4719
content: The "America Gives More Act of 2014" is the short title of this Act. It extends and expands the charitable deduction for contributions of food inventory. The "America Gives More Act of 2014" extends and expands the charitable deduction for contributions of food inventory. It amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 by removing certain clauses and increasing the limitation on contributions that can be taken into account for tax purposes. The "America Gives More Act of 2014" increases the limitation on charitable contributions for tax purposes, allowing for deductions based on taxable income. If the aggregate amount exceeds the limit, the excess can be treated as a charitable contribution. The "America Gives More Act of 2014" allows for charitable contributions to be spread over 5 years, coordinating with the corporate limitation on deductions. Contributions treated as allowable under subsection (b)(2)(A) can affect the determination of basis for certain taxpayers under section 170(e)(3)(C) of the tax code. In subparagraph (B), the basis of apparently wholesome food is considered equal to 25 percent of its fair market value. Fair market value determination is specified for contributions of such food that cannot be sold due to internal standards, lack of market, or other reasons. The fair market value of food contributions to qualifying organizations is determined based on the price at which similar food items are sold by the taxpayer, disregarding internal standards or exclusive purposes. The amendments made by this section apply to contributions made after December 31, 2013, in taxable years ending after that date, with specific applicability to c corporations. The text discusses tax deductions for contributions made by Native Corporations under the Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act, limited by the taxpayer's taxable income and charitable contributions. Contributions exceeding the limit can be carried over to the following year as charitable contributions. Amendments are made to ensure valid existing rights are preserved. The amendments made by this section preserve valid property rights conveyed to Native Corporations under the Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act. Effective date is after December 31, 2013. SEC. 5. EXTENSION OF TIME FOR MAKING CHARITABLE CONTRIBUTIONS. SEC. 5. EXTENSION OF TIME FOR MAKING CHARITABLE CONTRIBUTIONS. In General, subsection (a) of section 170 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to allow individuals to treat charitable contributions made after the close of a taxable year but before the due date of the tax return as if they were made in that taxable year. The amendments made by this section allow individuals to treat charitable contributions made after the close of a taxable year but before the due date of the tax return as if they were made in that taxable year, with an effective date for elections made after December 31, 2013. SEC. 6. The excise tax rate on investment income of private foundations is reduced from 2 percent to 1 percent, and the requirement for reduced tax is eliminated if certain distribution requirements are met. These amendments apply to taxable years starting after the enactment of this Act. SEC. 7. The budgetary effects of this Act will not be included in the PAYGO scorecards. The House of Representatives passed the bill on July 17, 2014. Karen L. Haas is the Clerk.
